availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Adam J. Bradford (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Maryland native. Son of James Bradford and Susan Bradford. Married to Lucinda Martha Morris Bradford. Father of Ann Jane Bradford, John H. Bradford, and Lillie B. Bradford. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 412A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 63.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 661.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 491A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Bradfordsville, p. 3A-B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Deaths.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #23537.
"Adam James Bradford (1815-1876)," Find A Grave, Memorial #21143876, accessed December 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21143876.
